ocr_markdown:
```markdown
21

$$ f(x) = 20(2)^x + 6(2)^x $$

The function $ f $ is defined by the given equation. Which of the following equivalent forms of $ f $ displays, as a coefficient or a base, the y-coordinate of the y-intercept of the graph of $ y = f(x) $ in the xy-plane?

A) $$ f(x) = 80(2)^{x - 2} + 24(2)^{x - 2} $$

B) $$ f(x) = 2(10(2)^{x} + 3(2)^{x}) $$

C) $$ f(x) = 20(4)^{\frac{2}{7}} + 6(4)^{\frac{2}{7}} $$

D) $$ f(x) = 26(2)^{x} $$
```

questions.question_text: The function $ f $ is defined by the given equation. Which of the following equivalent forms of $ f $ displays, as a coefficient or a base, the y-coordinate of the y-intercept of the graph of $ y = f(x) $ in the xy-plane?
questions.explanation: The y-intercept occurs when x=0. Original f(0)=20(2)^0+6(2)^0=20+6=26. Option D directly shows coefficient 26, which is the y-intercept.
